item.title: Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon Drops to Just $20 for Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/armored-core-vi-fires-of-rubicon-black-friday-deal-2024

Big mechs, bigger Black Friday savings.

FromSoftware has done it again, blending the chaos of battle with the strategy of customization in Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon. This Black Friday, you can snag the game on PS5 or Xbox at Amazon and Best Buy for just $19.99, down from its usual $59.99 price. That’s a $40 discount on a game that puts you in the pilot seat of a customizable mech for some of the most intense action of the year.

Armored Core VI Fires of Rubicon

Drawing from the expertise behind Dark Souls and Elden Ring, Armored Core VI offers a dynamic gameplay experience that combines 3D maneuverability with a mix of ranged and melee combat. It’s like they took FromSoftware’s signature challenge and sprinkled in some explosive mech mayhem, because why not?

The game’s story sends you to Rubicon 3, a contaminated wasteland where corporations and resistance groups are locked in a brutal battle to control a mysterious, catastrophic energy source. As a mercenary caught in the middle, it’s up to you to outfit your mech with the perfect loadout and dive into missions that require brains, brawn, and a little button-mashing finesse.

With Armored Core VI, it’s not just about blowing things up (though there’s plenty of that). The customization options let you create a mech that reflects your playstyle, whether precision strikes from afar or close-quarters carnage. Add a visually stunning world and epic boss battles, and you’ve got a recipe for hours of adrenaline-fueled fun. Let's not forget Armoured Core being pretty much a Soulsborne franchise but with mechs, so get good!

If you’ve been itching to join the mech party, now’s your chance. At $19.99 you’re not just saving $40, you’re scoring a ticket to one of the most exciting games in the genre. Don’t wait too long, though. Black Friday deals tend to disappear faster than a mech dodging enemy fire.

At 39% off, it's practically begging you to shout, "Mission accomplished!"

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 Hits All-Time Low Price for Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/warhammer-40000-space-marine-2-ps5-xbox-black-friday-deal

Rev up your chainsword.

A lot of big, excellent, high-scoring games have come out this year, so it’s perfectly understandable if you haven’t played them all. If you’ve been holding off on picking up Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, now is a good time to grab a copy: It’s on sale for a new all-time low price at Amazon.

You can snag it on PS5 or Xbox Series X for $49.99 at Amazon, a healthy $20 discount. And if you like shooters, you should absolutely pick it up, because it’s excellent.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 has a phenomenal campaign that you can play either single-player or with up to three friends. The story is nice and twisty, pitting you and your fellow futuristic military men against the alien Tyranid forces.

Once you’re done with the campaign, there’s a whole lot of cosmetic gear and armor colors you can collect by playing co-op missions or online multiplayer matches. The whole game is just a great shooter that delivers on the fundamentals. Plus, it looks fantastic, having left behind the previous generation of consoles. You can read my Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 review for more details to see whether it’ll appeal to you. I loved it, though, giving it an 8 out of 10.

Here’s the summary: “Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 is a terrific third-person shooter with a compelling story, loads of weapons that are a blast to use, and a healthy variety of enemies to use them on. It once again borrows many of its ideas from the Gears of War series, but they’re good ideas, and Space Marine 2 does a fine job of making them its own. And while the Operations PvE mode that accompanies it doesn’t currently offer enough to keep me coming back, the deep customization options for your Space Marine do look promising if it’s supported in post-launch updates as planned. Besides, when you’re eviscerating aliens on planets as pretty as these, it’s hard not to leave satisfied. “

item.title: Nintendo Black Friday 2024 Sale is Now Live – These Are The Best Switch Deals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/nintendo-switch-best-black-friday-deals-2024

Nintendo Black Friday deals are now officially live, with a whole slew of unbeatable discounts now available on consoles, games, accessories, and more. Most importantly, the best-ever Switch deal is live, with an additional $75 off the Switch Black Friday bundles.

This screams, "Switch 2 is coming soon, please buy our console" but we're not complaining. If you've been after a Switch, this is the deal for Black Friday, and it's pretty incredible. Check out the rest of our top picks below and stay tuned for details on more upcoming offers.

TL;DR - Best Switch Black Friday Deals

  • Switch OLED: MK8 Bundle - $274.99
  • Switch: MK8 Bundle - $224.99
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations - $29.99
  • Super Mario Odyssey - $29.99
  • Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom - $39.99
  • Switch Pro Controller - $49.99
  • TeamGroup A2 Pro Plus Card 1TB - $57.99

Don't have time to scroll? These are the best overall deals for Switch owners (or prospective Switch owners).

Switch Black Friday Console Deals

Switch OLED: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Bundle

Switch: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Bundle

Nintendo has rolled out a standout Black Friday deal for 2024, offering the Switch OLED bundle at $275 and the standard Switch bundle at $225. Both bundles include a digital copy of Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and a 12-month Nintendo Switch Online subscription, marking them one of the best Black Friday deals available in 2024.

Even with the anticipated Switch 2 expected next year, this deal is likely to be extremely popular. Together, the bundles represent a $155 saving compared to buying each item separately. The inclusion of a full year of NSO membership is also a notable upgrade from past bundles, which typically featured just three months of Nintendo Switch Online.

Switch Black Friday Game Deals

Phase two of Nintendo’s Black Friday sale is now live, offering plenty of great deals across popular Switch titles. Retailers like Best Buy and Target have already rolled out some standout discounts. Current highlights include Sonic X Generations for $29.99, Super Mario Odyssey for $29.99, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom for $44.99, and Balatro for $19.99.

Tears of the Kingdom is also discounted to $39.99, though it will drop to $29.99 at Walmart tomorrow for those willing to wait. These deals are expected to sell quickly, so now is a great time to take advantage of the savings.

Nintendo Switch Accessory Black Friday Deals

The Nintendo Switch and Switch OLED offer 32GB and 64GB of internal storage, respectively, with some of that reserved for the operating system. To put this into perspective, Tears of the Kingdom takes up 16GB, while Breath of the Wild requires about 13.5GB. Downloading both games digitally would nearly fill the original Switch's storage, making a high-capacity memory card less of a luxury and more of a necessity.

Nintendo Switch Joy-Con and Controller Deals

Joy-Con Wireless Controllers for Nintendo Switch - Neon Red/Neon Blue

Nintendo Switch Pro Controller

Black Friday is a perfect time to pick up any Nintendo Switch controllers you could use, because they pretty much all go on sale for the lowest prices of the year. That goes for both Joy-Con controllers and standard Pro-style controllers.

Thankfully, Black Friday sales make storage upgrades much more affordable. A 1TB microSD card is now available for $57.99, while a 512GB card can be picked up for just $32.99, offering ample space for games, DLC, and updates. Portable gaming needs are also covered, with one of the best power banks on the market dropping to its lowest price ever at $77.99. Additionally, Switch Pro controllers are now just $49.99, making this Black Friday an excellent time to grab essential accessories at significant discounts.

Should You Sign Up for Walmart+ Before Nov. 25?

Walmart+ 12-Month Membership

One of the standout deals in Walmart’s first wave of Black Friday offers is a 50% discount on a 12-month Walmart+ membership. Usually priced at $98, it's now available for $49. The membership includes several perks, starting with 5-hour early access to Walmart's next round of Black Friday deals, which begins at noon ET on Monday, November 25, and notably includes that Tears of the Kingdom deal for $29.99.

It’s not worth signing up for Walmart+ just to snag that single deal—you’d likely be better off purchasing the game at its regular price. Instead, consider whether early access to Walmart’s upcoming deals or the other benefits of a 12-month membership make sense for you. Take some time to weigh the value of the subscription against your shopping habits to decide if it’s the right choice.

When is Black Friday This Year?

We hope you've prepared your wallets, because it's Black Friday season. During the biggest sales event of the year, keep an eye out for price drops on the games you've been waiting to add to your library. The same can be said for TVs, gaming PCs, Apple products, and more.

Whatever you're in the market for, right now is probably one of the best times to make your biggest purchases. The sale going live means we are one step closer to Black Friday proper, with deals for PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo already confirmed. Let's dig into all the best PlayStation Black Friday deals.

Free In-Store Switch Events

Nintendo is also organizing in-person demo events at Target, Best Buy, and GameStop, giving players a chance to try upcoming games and participate in giveaways.

  • Dec. 7: Best Buy Family Fun Day will offer hands-on demos for games like Mario & Luigi: Brothership, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, Super Mario Party Jamboree, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, and Just Dance 2025.
  • Dec. 14: GameStop will host demos for the same lineup.

item.title: Sonic X Shadow Generations Is On Sale for Black Friday – It's My Game of the Year
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/sonic-x-shadow-generations-black-friday-deal-2024

One of the season's best gaming deals yet.

Have you tried Sonic X Shadow Generations yet? If not, now’s the perfect time. It's down to $29.99 / £27.99 for Black Friday – $20 off the price it launched at just over a month ago. This isn’t a sign of trouble; Sega often discounts even its top-performing games during Black Friday sales. Instead, this is simply one of the season's best gaming deals.

  • Sonic x Shadow Generations - Amazon UK, £27.99

For $30, you’re getting Sonic Generations remastered, paired with the ultimate Shadow experience in Shadow Generations. It’s an incredible package and a contender for game of the year in my opinion. Whether you're a Sonic fan or not, this is a must-play experience and a bargain at this price.

IGN’s Jada Griffen reviewed the game, awarding it a 9: “Sonic X Shadow Generations takes an already excellent game and spring jumps it to new heights at a blistering pace by doubling up the campaign length with creative level design, fantastic bosses, plenty of collectibles, and an appreciable graphical upgrade.”

Robert's Favorite Games Played in 2024 (So Far)

Everything I've loved playing this year, which also includes some games I revisited, and even some oldies I played for the first time.

“While the brand-new Shadow content isn't necessarily long on its own, it adds a nice change of pace to the collection of all-time great Sonic stages Generations already contained, and there’s an exciting new story that’s filled in as you explore the overworld for collectibles, activities, and challenges.”

“This bulked-up remaster soars far and above previous enhanced versions we've gotten in the Sonic franchise, and hopefully will be the gold standard Sega holds itself to when it decides to bring back other Sonic games from the past.”

More Switch Black Friday Deals

The actual date of Black Friday in 2024 falls on November 29, but the holiday deals season starts a lot earlier than that. Plenty of retailers have already been dropping deals online. More and more deals will roll out leading up to the event, which culminates in massive discounts on Black Friday. Retailers will not reveal their biggest Black Friday deals until the big day, but most general deals will be available well in advance, such as the impressive Sonic deal.

"It's only one of the best video game franchises ever," they say. Well, now you and I can grab a copy of Infinite Wealth, for just $24.99 on Amazon and find out for ourselves.
